jobs.title: Head of Talent Acquisition
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Nelo

Nelo is a leading consumer fintech in Mexico, with >$350MM in annualized GMV, >$60MM in annualized revenue, and >$20MM in annualized gross profit. Our mission is to increase the buying power of consumers in Latin America, and we are doing so by building a modern alternative to credit cards.

Nelo has raised over $35MM of venture capital from investors including Homebrew, Two Sigma Ventures, and Susa Ventures. Nelo has additionally raised a $100MM asset credit facility from Victory Park Capital.

Our lean team includes experienced leaders from top technology companies including Uber, Amazon, Rappi, and DiDi. We pride ourselves on our velocity, intellectual rigor, and efficiency.

Nelo has offices in Mexico City and New York City.

About the Role

We are seeking a Head of Talent Acquisition to own and execute Nelo’s recruiting strategy across Mexico and the U.S. This is a high-impact, hands-on role where you will directly source, engage, and close top talent across engineering, data science, risk, and commercial functions.

You will report directly to the CTO and will work closely with the CEO and other senior leaders.

Initially, this will be an individual contributor role — you will be both strategist and executor, building the recruiting engine from the ground up. As we scale, you will have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role and build a team around you.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Own full-cycle recruiting across functions and levels — from sourcing and outreach through closing candidates.

  • Partner directly with the executive team to define role requirements, assess candidates, and drive hiring decisions.

  • Proactively source passive candidates and build strong talent pipelines for critical roles.

  • Develop recruiting processes to maximize speed, quality, and candidate experience.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of recruiting/talent acquisition experience, including proven success in high-growth technology companies.

  • Track record of independently sourcing and closing top technical, product, and business candidates.

  • Strong understanding of recruiting tools, sourcing strategies, and funnel optimization.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build trust with both candidates and executives.

  • Hands-on, scrappy, and execution-oriented — comfortable owning results without a large team or infrastructure.

  • Proficient in English and Spanish

Compensation and Benefits

  • Very competitive salary and equity

  • 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you; 50% for dependents

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 401(k)

  • Extended maternity and paternity leave

  • Relocation support

  • Sabbatical program

jobs.title: Senior Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Nelo

Nelo is a leading consumer fintech in Mexico, with >$400MM in annualized GMV, >$60MM in revenue, and >$20MM in gross profit. Our mission is to increase the buying power of consumers in Latin America by building a modern alternative to credit cards.

We’ve raised over $25MM of venture capital from Homebrew, Two Sigma Ventures, and Susa Ventures, along with a $100MM credit facility from Victory Park Capital.

Our lean team includes experienced operators from Uber, Amazon, Rappi, and DiDi. We pride ourselves on our velocity, intellectual rigor, and efficiency. Nelo is headquartered in Mexico City with offices in New York City.

About the Role

We are looking for a senior recruiter to own and execute Nelo’s recruiting strategy across Mexico and the U.S. This is a high-impact, hands-on role where you will directly source, engage, and close world-class talent across engineering, data science, risk, and commercial functions.

You will report directly to the CTO, and collaborate closely with the CEO and other senior leaders.

Responsibilities

  • Lead full-cycle recruiting across all functions and levels, from sourcing to closing.

  • Partner with executives to define role requirements, assess candidates, and guide hiring decisions.

  • Proactively source passive candidates and build robust talent pipelines for critical hires.

  • Develop and implement scalable recruiting processes that optimize for speed, quality, and candidate experience.

  • Act as a trusted ambassador of Nelo’s culture and mission in every candidate interaction.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of recruiting experience, with proven success in high-growth technology companies.

  • Track record of sourcing and closing top technical, product, and business talent.

  • Strong knowledge of recruiting tools, sourcing strategies, and funnel optimization.

  • Excellent communicator who can build trust with candidates and executives alike.

  • Hands-on, scrappy, and execution-oriented — thrives in a fast-paced, lean environment.

  • English proficiency required; Spanish proficiency strongly preferred.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Very competitive salary and equity package

  • 100% medical, dental & vision coverage (you); 50% coverage (dependents)

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 401(k)

  • Extended maternity & paternity leave

  • Relocation support

  • Sabbatical program

jobs.title: Data Scientist (NYC, L5/L6)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Nelo

Nelo is a leading consumer fintech in Mexico, with >$350MM in annualized GMV, >$60MM in annualized revenue, and >$20MM in annualized gross profit. Our mission is to increase the buying power of consumers in Latin America, and we are doing so by building a modern alternative to credit cards.

Nelo has raised over $35MM of venture capital from investors including Homebrew, Two Sigma Ventures and Susa Ventures. Nelo has additionally raised a $100MM asset credit facility from Victory Park Capital.

Our lean team includes experienced leaders from top technology companies including Uber, Amazon, Rappi, and DiDi. We pride ourselves on our velocity, intellectual rigor, and efficiency.

Nelo has offices in Mexico City and New York City.

About The Role

As a data scientist at Nelo, you will be responsible for optimizing the overall performance of our credit and marketplace products. Specifically, you will

  1. Develop machine learning and causality models upon which Nelo will make underwriting and portfolio management decisions

  2. Create credit, personalization, ranking, and pricing algorithms

  3. Design and analyze continuous experiments to provide insights and guide product and algorithm decisions

  4. Lead machine learning infrastructure projects, include machine learning operations and observability

This role requires a deep knowledge of machine learning and statistics. Cross-functional collaboration is also needed.

We are looking for someone with a strong technical background and clarity of thought. You should be a great communicator and have the ability to drive impact based on your analyses.

This role is in-office in New York City.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of data science experience

  • Deep understanding of classification models, forecasting models and ML techniques

  • Deep understanding of causal inference, experiment design and measurements

  • Deep understanding of optimization, including familiarity with formulating and solving constrained optimization problems

  • Advanced with SQL and Python

Compensation and Benefits:

  • Very competitive salary and equity

  • 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you; 50% for dependents

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 401(k)

  • Extended maternity and paternity leave

  • Relocation support

  • Sabbatical program

jobs.title: Credit Generalist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location

NYC or Mexico City, 4 days/wk in office

Language

English required, Spanish nice to have

About the Role

We're looking for a technical, curious, and also good person to lead a lot of credit initiatives at Nelo, a leading consumer lender in Mexico.

Types of things you might work on:

  • Core credit risk segmentation; which groups of users are performing better or worse than our models expected? Also automating this more.

  • Analysis and experiments related to line assignment, loan duration, product access, account valuation, and pricing

  • Collaborate closely with data science to create/suggest features for them to include in models

  • Loss forecasting

  • Portfolio stress testing

  • Making charts for portfolio observability

  • Investor diligence

Being technical (writing SQL, making charts, some python) is table stakes. In this role you’ll be pushed beyond your current analytical boundaries. You’ll need to learn new skills, and sometimes you’ll be the only one who really knows what those new skills should be. Regardless of how analytical you are today, you’re probably the type of person who aims to ~double that over the next five years.

It’s also important for you to be curious to succeed in this role. We have a huge amount of data at our disposal, and there are nearly unlimited combinations of the data that could be tested or used, and it will take some judgment and plain curiosity to cut through the noise and unlock previously undiscovered patterns, features, and trends.

Qualifications

  • Can be flexible on experience but I’m imagining 2-8 years of experience in credit risk strategy / analytics, with at least some of that being in consumer lending.

  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, and you’re at least not a stranger to Python.

  • Excited about building with AI. Maybe you’ve made a personal or work app in Claude Code, for example.

  • Experience with credit in LATAM, particularly Mexico, is preferred (but not required).

  • I really like pretty charts so if you have above-average chart design aptitude, that would be properly appreciated here.

About Nelo

Nelo is building a modern alternative to a credit card, designed from first principles for a world of real-time and mobile payments. Our mission is to increase the buying power of consumers in Latin America.

I’ve worked at a number of fintechs now, and Nelo really stands out. The founders, Kyle and Stephen, are world class operators that brought the experimentation culture from Uber and applied it to a lending company in Mexico. The result after years of compounding is incredible; it must be near the top of its vintage (2019) for lending fintechs. We’re at a nearly $60mm annualized revenue run rate, and are profitable on a net basis (though not much, since we reinvest as much would-be profit as we can back into growth), all with ~45 people at the company.

We’ve raised from some of the best investors, including Homebrew, Two Sigma Ventures and Susa Ventures. We also have plenty of debt capital from reputable lenders. We're a relatively senior and technical team, and we pride ourselves on our velocity, intellectual rigor, and efficiency. This isn’t financial advice or whatever, but I’ll be honest, I'm excited about the value of my equity. Come build with the team and I!

- Russell

Compensation and Benefits

  • Base salary: NYC: $150-200K, CDMX: COL-adjusted

  • Competitive equity. Initial grant + annual refreshes, equity bonus based on performance.

  • 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 401(k) for US-based employees

  • Extended maternity and paternity leave

  • Relocation support

  • Both of our offices are awesome and have good snacks
